title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks on Friday 14 August 2015 - BBC News
summary: a plot to burgle the buckinghamshire home of late entertainer cilla black has been foiled , her son says .
a woman is taken to hospital after a fire involving three houses in buckingham .
more children in the three counties than ever are having to be fed by food banks during the school holidays , a charity says .
an 83-year-old woman from dunstable says she wo n't pay a £ 50 fine for ignoring signs and sitting on a park bench with a dog .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: have a good weekend
text: that 's all from us on beds , herts and bucks live for this week .
hope you can join us again from 08:00 on monday .
if you missed anything today , here 's a quick round-up of some of our top stories :

documents.title: sunshine forecast for this weekend
text: mostly rather cloudy with some showery rain moving east this evening , then becoming mainly dry again later .
winds will become light north westerly , and the minimum temperature around 12c ( 54f ) .
saturday will be a mainly dry day , with patchy cloud and sunny periods and only a very small chance of a shower .
winds light north westerly with a maximum temperature around 21c ( 70f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: strictly exhibition sparkles at woburn
text: keeeeep dancing !
all the way to

the exhibition opens tomorrow for the next 11 weeks and showcases 16 dresses from last year 's shows , including those above - the charleston dress worn by winner caroline flack ( left ) and pixie lott 's waltz dress ( right ) .
chris gravett , curator of woburn abbey , said : `` it is a wonderful celebration of fantastic costumes combined with breath-taking art and architecture in historic surroundings .
we hope visitors will score the display a 10 ! ''
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: funeral crowd funding 'unbelievable '
text: a man from hemel hempstead with terminal liver cancer says the amount of support he has received to help pay for his funeral via crowd funding has been unbelievable .
andy williams , 43 , says he is thankful to everyone who has donated to help reach the £ 3,000 target required .
`` it means a lot to me '' , mr williams said .
`` if it was n't for family and friends helping us i would n't have a clue where to start . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: bedford band don broco album at # 6 in official charts
text: bedford-lads don broco 's second album , automatic , released last week , has made it to number six in the charts .
the official charts

documents.title: hornets respond to capacity reports
text: watford fc have released a statement following a

the club writes that the stadium is `` fit for full capacity for tomorrow 's fixture with west bromwich albion '' and that they `` look forward to welcoming supporters for tomorrow 's first home game of the 2015/16 premier league campaign '' .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: cilla black : police investigation after plot to burgle home
text: security at late singer cilla black 's denham home has been increased following a plot to burgle the property just a week before her funeral .
all valuables including art , jewellery and personal items have been removed after a professionally cut circular hole was found in the perimeter fence .
`` i can not believe someone would stoop so low at a time like this , '' her eldest son robert willis said .
`` it 's inconceivable .
thankfully it was discovered in time . ''
police are investigating .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: cilla black burglary plot not the first
text: a foiled plot to burgle the home of late singer
the house in denham was last broken into in 2003 by three masked men who attacked her son jack with a crowbar , before making off with jewellery worth more than £ 1m .
the 72-year-old entertainer died from a traumatic head injury during a fall at her home in spain ,
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: cilla black : plot to burgle bucks home foiled
text: a plot to burgle the buckinghamshire home of
her son robert willis says it 's inconceivable that someone could stoop so low ahead of her funeral next week .
mr willis says that a professionally cut circular hole was discovered in the perimeter fence of her home in the village of denham .
author: Lee Agnew
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: breakingplot to burgle cilla black 's bucks home foiled
text: a plot to burgle the buckinghamshire home of late entertainer cilla black has been foiled , her eldest son robert willis said in a statement .

documents.title: baggaley questions olympic legacy
text: london 2012 olympic table tennis player

the milton keynes-based 32-year-old , who was a 2012 bid ambassador , said : `` the country was so united in 2012 and everyone was going sport crazy , but it seems strange that no one 's really capitalised on it .
`` not only table tennis , but i 'd like to see the other sports you do n't see . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: 'voodoo doll ' removed in bedford
text: a diy 'goblin ' taped to a lamppost in bedford town centre has been
author: Beds on Sunday

documents.title: blade update : nose for a trolley dash
text: it 's friday , so i thought i 'd treat you to a bit of a puppy fix !
i 'm talking about blade of course , the newest addition to the beds , cambs and herts police dog unit and our puppy pin-up .
blade 's handler has been taking him out to climb on lots of different surfaces , which is an important part of his training to become a police dog .
when operational , police dogs have to be 100 % focussed on tracking a scent , so they ca n't hesitate over unusual surfaces , which is why such training is so important .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: warning against hare coursing
text: potential hare courses are being warned against the pursuit by hertfordshire police as the harvesting period gets underway .
police say that this activity will not be tolerated and anyone caught , or suspected to be taking part , will be dealt with robustly .
hare coursing , where hounds chase down hares , has been illegal in the uk for 10 years .
people taking part often bet on which hound will get to the hare first .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: chemical in henna tattoo 'mutilated ' herts teen
text: the mother of a teenager who may be left scarred after suffering severe burns from a henna tattoo says `` it 's like her body 's been mutilated in some way '' .
mary bates , 16 , from st albans , was on holiday in turkey when she had the temporary tattoo painted on her ankle .
she did n't know
`` it 's dangerous , it can cause death if people have a severe reaction to it '' , mary 's mother lisa said .
`` anything that can be done to stop it from happening to other people is really important . ''
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: what we 're talking about
text: the top stories this afternoon :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: vicarage road could see capacity reduced
text: watford fc 's sir elton john stand could have its capacity reduced by 1,000 for tomorrow 's first premier league home game , it has emerged .
author: Watford Observer

documents.title: ogilvie and kettings join stevenage
text: stevenage have
ogilvie can play at left-back or centre-back , but has yet to play a first-team match for spurs .
the 19-year-old played 16 times in the under-21 premier league last term and has joined on a one-month youth loan .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: beds care home should 've 'got to grips with problems '
text: a bedfordshire care home which closed last week had been told to `` get to grips with their problems '' and `` sort them out '' , the care quality commission has said .
the old village nursing home in marston moretaine was shut down last friday , with residents being rehomed into the early hours .
in a statement , the care home said : `` we have had no choice other than to close the home .
we have been working with other stakeholders to ensure a smooth process in relocating residents .
we are very saddened by this outcome . ''
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: watford attackers must fit flores 's system
text: at goodison park last weekend odion ighalo , who scored 20 goals last season , was on the bench .
so too was matej vydra , who scored 16 last term .
fernando forestieri did n't even make the squad .
with steven berghuis and almen abdi set to be match fit soon , and alessandro diamanti about to join , which attackers get in the team ?
it 's simple : the ones who understand head coach quique flores 's system best .
flores plays two holding midfielders in etienne capoue and valon behrami , but do n't get fooled into thinking they 're the only midfielders who have to do the leg work .
at everton it was noticeable just how much work and tracking the four 'attackers ' ( layun , jurado , anya , deeney ) did .
these wo n't be luxury players .
i put this to flores this week .
he smiled .
of the attackers who played saturday , he said : `` they are very clever .
they understand very fast what we want . ''
author: Geoff Doyle
BBC Three Counties Radio sport

documents.title: if you 're just catching up
text: the top stories this lunchtime :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: ll camps : director remanded in custody
text: a director of a children 's summer camp in hertfordshire has appeared before st albans crown court today .
ben lewis , 25 , of lullington garth , borehamwood , has been remanded in custody after being charged with possessing indecent images of children .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: buckingham house fire spread from kitchen
text: firefighters say smoke alarms saved the life of a woman , believed to be in her 90s , in a house fire in buckingham last night .
watch commander john robinson said : `` we believe that the fire started in the kitchen .

due to the amount of combustible material within the property , that caused the fire to spread through the ground and first floor into the roof space , which then spread across damaging a further two properties . ''
more than 30 firefighters tackled the blaze in gawcott road , just before 23:30 yesterday .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: some brighter spells possible this afternoon
text: some brighter breaks are possible this afternoon , especially around stevenage and welwyn garden city in the east .
however , further rain and perhaps thundery showers will return from the west through the afternoon and evening .
maximum temperature : 21c ( 70f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: care home in beds 'simply dreadful '
text: the care at a nursing home in bedfordshire which was shut down last friday has been described by the care quality commission as `` simply dreadful '' .
old village school care home in marston moretaine is now under police investigation due to allegations of abuse .

andrew sutcliffe , chief inspector of adult social care at the cqc , said : `` the examples of deteriorating care in this case , many of which we are unable to report on until the legal process is fully complete , are simply dreadful and i am appalled that the provider allowed the situation to get this bad . ''
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: hertfordshire teen could be scarred for life after henna tattoo
text: a teenager from st albans
sixteen-year-old mary bates had the temporary tattoo painted on her ankle last month , but the dye contained ppd , a chemical that 's illegal in the eu .
after returning home she was taken to a specialist burns unit to help treat the blistering .
`` they were cleaning it and bits of skin were just coming off , '' she said .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: liz kendall : labour will submit 'resignation letter ' if corbyn wins
text: the labour leadership candidate liz kendall says the party will be submitting `` a resignation letter '' to the british public if jeremy corbyn wins the contest .
the hertfordshire-born mp has urged her supporters to back anyone but mr corbyn in the

`` if we 're going to win back seats in herts , beds and bucks , we 've got to convince people that they can trust us on the economy and with their taxes , and we 've got to have a message about the future , '' she said .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: buckingham house fire : woman in hospital
text: a woman believed to be in her 90s was taken to hospital after a house fire , which spread to two other properties , in buckingham last night .
watch commander john robinson said : `` we do believe that there were smoke alarms in the first property and that 's why the victim was able to escape with her life .
`` the first property was 100 % destroyed , the second property has no roof and the amount of water that we 've had to use to extinguish the fire has cause extensive damage .
and the third property , there 's damage to the roof and the first floor . ''
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: luton town drawn at home to premier league side
text: luton have been drawn at home to premier league opposition in the second round of the capital one cup .
the hatters will host stoke in the week commencing 24 august .
watford will travel to newly-promoted championship side preston , while mk dons host fellow championship side cardiff .
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: councillor says 83-year-old was 'clearly breaching ' dog control order
text: an 83-year-old woman who was
gwendoline goring says she can not afford to pay the £ 50 fine for the incident in the park in french 's avenue , dunstable .
but councillor budge wells , the deputy executive member for community services ,
however , he has said that he 'll look into the case `` with a view to doing the right thing '' .
author: Jonathan Vernon-Smith
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: more children being fed by food banks
text: more children in the three counties than ever are having to be fed by food banks during the school holidays , according to the charity

rachel warwick , from the charity , said : `` one of the kitchens in luton recently was run by the school , so we had 100 pupils coming everyday who 'd been invited by the school , but then you have others where the attendance is much lower .
`` it takes time to build up trust .
it 's a very difficult thing to admit that you 're struggling to feed your children . ''
the charity 's set-up five summer holiday food banks in luton , aylesbury and hemel , with plans to open in bedford and milton keynes .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: boys , 8 , tackle blaze
text: two eight-year-old brothers sprang into action to
author: The Comet

documents.title: man dies after hitchin crash
text: a man in his 80s has died after crashing his car into a garden wall in hitchin yesterday afternoon .
the crash happened on offley road at about 14:00 , when the man 's red jaguar hit the wall near the junction with the a505 pirton road .
he died later at the lister hospital in stevenage .
his passenger , a woman in her 60s , suffered slight injuries .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: the news so far
text: the top stories we 're looking at this morning :
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

text: padded seats , an unobstructed view and £ 14 cheaper than a matchday ticket at brisbane road -
author: Milton Keynes Citizen

documents.title: slow traffic and delayed trains
text: there 's
on the a6 in bedfordshire , one lane is closed northbound in barton-le-clay , after the luton road junction , due to an overturned car towing a trailer .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: majority of commuters 'travel by car '
text: the new report that says
the
the majority of commuters travel by car , and mainly to jobs elsewhere , it added .
the report examined the commuting habits of people in five towns around london , including hemel hempstead , watford and high wycombe .
author: Carol Abercrombie
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: travel news : crash on m1
text: one lane has been shut and there is very slow traffic on the m1 southbound around milton keynes because of an accident involving a car , van and lorry near to junction 13 for the a421 .
there is congestion on the a6 northbound in barton-le-clay , with one lane being closed because of an overturned car towing a trailer .
heavy traffic has also been reported on the a6 paula radcliffe way in bedford , near to the clapham road junction , due to roadworks .
you can get the latest at
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: woman , 83 , fined for sitting in play area with dog
text: an 83-year-old woman from dunstable says she wo n't pay a fine for sitting on a park bench with her dog .
gwendoline goring , who has asthma , said she was out of breath in the park off french 's avenue so sat down for five minutes on a bench in a children 's play area , where dogs are banned .
she said a council warden gave her a fine for £ 80 , which would be reduced to £ 50 if paid within a number of days .
ms goring said £ 50 amounts to half her weekly pension money .
we 'll bring you more on what she and the local council has to say shortly .
author: David Keller
BBC News Online

documents.title: greenbelt building would 'cause congestion '
text: building on greenbelt land in hertfordshire and buckinghamshire would cause even more congestion on the roads , according to
the
the report says that building a million new homes on greenbelt land is likely to result in a huge increase in the number of car journeys being made on already congested roads .
author: Carol Abercrombie
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: weather forecast : rain and thundery showers
text: it will be a cloudy , humid and misty morning .
some brighter spells are possible this afternoon , especially around stevenage and welwyn garden city in the east .
however , further rain and perhaps thundery showers will return from the west through the afternoon and evening .
maximum temperature : 21c ( 70f ) .
rain will gradually clear to the east overnight , with cloud breaking from the west to allow some clear spells to develop .
minimum temperature : 10c ( 50f ) .
you can
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: thirty firefighters tackle buckingham blaze
text: here 's what the fire in buckingham looked like last night .
more than 30 firefighters tackled the blaze involving three houses on gawcott road just before midnight .
a woman was treated for the effects of breathing in smoke , but fortunately there appears to have been no serious injuries .
if you were an eyewitness , please get in touch with your comments and via
author: David Keller
BBC News Online

documents.title: good morning
text: hello again .
it 's friday , 14 august , and we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , weather and travel for beds , herts and bucks until 18:00 .
we 'll do our best to bring you the friday feeling with the miserable weather about .
i 'll bring you a full forecast soon - but i 'm sure you do n't need me to tell you that a brolly would be handy today .
as always , we 'd love you to share your stories and comments with us .
you can do it via
author: David Keller
BBC News Online
